examples: my boss let me leave early
synonyms: entitle to; archaicsuffer to "let him sleep for now"

definitions.definition: allow to pass in a particular direction.
examples: could you let the dog out?
synonyms: permit to pass; make way for "Wilcox opened the door to let her through"

definitions.definition: used in the imperative to formulate various expressions.
used as a polite way of making or responding to a suggestion, giving an instruction, or introducing a remark.
used to make a polite offer of help.
used to express one's strong desire for something to happen or be the case.
examples: “Dear God,” Jessica prayed, “let him be all right.”

definitions.definition: used as a way of expressing defiance or challenge.
examples: if he wants to walk out, well, let him!

definitions.definition: used to express an assumption upon which a theory or calculation is to be based.
examples: let A and B stand for X and Y, respectively

definitions.definition: allow someone to have the use of (a room or property) in return for regular payments; rent.
examples: homeowners will be able to let rooms to lodgers without having to pay tax

definitions.definition: award (a contract for a particular project) to an applicant.
examples: preliminary contracts were let and tunneling work started

definitions.definition: (in racket sports) a play that is nullified and has to be played again, especially when a served ball touches the top of the net.

examples: pray you let us not; we fain would greet our mother
